But, as Donald Rumsfeld writes, he's never much of a handwringer, I don't spend a lot of time in recriminations, looking back or second-guessing decisions made in real time with imperfect information by myself or others. As seems typical of so much here, that's partially true; the author has no taste for self-criticism or second-guessing himself. Masterful bureaucratic survivor that he was until he ran out of room to maneuver

But everyone knows that the decision Hunt is taking is 100 per cent political because of the noise around phone hacking and the idea that Rupert Murdoch has an influence on Number 10. who accuses the tabloid of hacking her messages. While lawyers say more celebrities are about to accuse journalists of hacking their phones, Deputy Tony Blair Nick Clegg sought to draw a line under the controversy. I don't think this government will miss a beat in terms of just pressing ahead with the plan that we have set out for the next four and a half years, he told the BBC. " Andy Coulson has been very clear that he was not in any way responsible for phone hacking or had any knowledge of it. I have no reason to disbelieve him."
